snippet: A study by Standard & Poor’s found that China’s nonfinancial companies had total outstanding bank loans and bonds worth $14.2 trillion at the end of last year, compared with $13.1 trillion in the United States.
abstract: A study by Standard & Poor’s found that China’s nonfinancial companies had total outstanding bank loans and bonds worth $14.2 trillion at the end of last year, compared with $13.1 trillion in the United States.

headline.main: China Surpasses U.S. as Largest Corporate Debt Issuer
